part.line: Down with the Entertainment Software Association!
Great, it's the guy from Monday.
Down with the ESA and all involved!
He's tarnishing the reputation of our people, guys.
We've got to show him up.
part.narration: Everyone shuffles around the room, strategizing.

choice.narration: Raymond is a Plumber. She goes into the bathroom. She closes the door. She goes down the pipe. She pops out on the other end of the pipe. Now she's outside. Yuki catches up.

Raymond is a stunt double. She leaves the hotel room. Nothing productive happens and then Raymond comes running through the room and leaps from the first-story balcony. She lands in a pile of hay. A shake here, a shake there, and Yuki emerges.

part.narration: Yuki and friends make their way through the crowds of golden-rimmed SUVs and diamond wedding rings and glass-screened cellphones, down the street to the area of protest.Yuki, Davis, and Raymond in party.
part.line: "Combatting governmentally imposed game censorship and regulation?"
More like excusing their sick creations!
Defending the artistic integrity of the video game?
More like finding excuses to call Manhunt 2 tame!
The ESA's founder left the game industry!
Where is this group's direction without its king bee?
Do these people have the credibility to judge one murder simulator from another?
part.narration: Yuki reaches the makeshift podium. She takes the microphone from the man. Yuki announces:
part.line: Sir, you are like C before 1983 —
part.narration: Some scratch their heads. Leashed chihuahuas stop mid-sidewalk. The crowd watches on. The man raises his arms to his face.
